comment.author: 8062154@N04
comment._content:
Killmallie built in Glasgow in 1893, a 3 masted barque it plied its trade between GB, Australia and S America. Nearly sunk in storms in 1920 in Bay of Biscay, rescued and repaired in Lisbon before resuming her travels. Eventually broken up in 1926 in Bowness.
1634 ton, 245ft long, 37ft breadth, 22.7 ft depth.
My GG Father was master of her in 1908.
More info available from bcarr4@aol.com

comment.author: 56974373@N08
comment._content: Barque Kilmallie built in Glasgow 1893. My father sailed on the Kilmallie for aprox. five years. He sailed from GB, South America, Australia. He was on board during the Storm (Huricane) in 1920 while crossing the Bay of Biscay. He sailed under Cpt. Henry. As far as I know my father took these photographs of the Barque Kilmallie during the storm in the Bay of Biscay.I have many of the negatives. I also have some news clippings and stories written about the Kilmallie.A search on flicker will produce some of these photos. If you would like more info contact myself at rod_balfour@yahoo.com
